column3: I went ahead and made the change suggested by @laanwj. I also threw in a period on another line for conformity's sake.
Looks good to me.\nPlease squash your commits (see here how: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits), then this should be ready for merge.
I don't think this log message 'user has been found' is very illuminating, out of the blue. Something like `Using rpcauth authentication` would be clearer, I think.

I 100% agree with you and had that originally. The reason I changed it is because I do no verification that the entries are valid, just that they exist. I wanted to put the log wherever the client did the verification of them; but, as far as I can tell, they aren't even looked at until an RPC user authentication is attempted. I didn't want to promise that they are being used without doing so, and
